skill.name: code-example-generator
skill.description: Generate pedagogically effective code examples that activate understanding, not just demonstrate syntax. Use when creating code examples for educational content, tutorials, or documentation.
skill.summary: Generate pedagogically effective code examples that activate understanding, not just demonstrate syn...
skill.author: 92Bilal26

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill. Contains no executable code, scripts, network calls, or command execution. All detected patterns are false positives from markdown documentation context (code examples, git branch names, standard library references). The skill is a prompt template for generating educational code examples.

content.value_statement: Teaching code requires more than syntax demonstration. This skill generates production-relevant examples using reasoning-driven pedagogy that activates understanding through spec-first, show-then-explain patterns.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-relevant code examples (not toy apps)
Apply bilingual examples for Python and TypeScript concepts
Use spec-first workflow for intentional learning design
Validate syntax and execution before presenting examples
limitations: Generates example code for teaching, not new applications
Cannot execute or test code directly in target environment
Requires user to understand basic programming concepts
Operates within provided specs; cannot create new specifications

use_cases.title: Create learning materials
use_cases.description: Generate structured code examples for courses, tutorials, and workshops with proper pedagogical sequencing.

use_cases.title: Document code patterns
use_cases.description: Create production-relevant pattern examples for team documentation and onboarding materials.

use_cases.title: Build example libraries
use_cases.description: Generate validated code examples aligned to learning objectives for technical documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a simple function example for A2 (guided) learners showing how to define and call a Python function with parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Class Example
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a class example for B1 (intermediate) learners demonstrating Python classes with init method and instance attributes.

prompt_templates.title: Async Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Python async/await example for B2 learners showing how to run concurrent HTTP requests with proper error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Decorator Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a production-relevant Python decorator example (@login_required pattern) for B1 learners with test cases.

output_examples.input: Generate an example teaching Python async/await for B2 developers
output: Shows working async code with aiohttp
Explains async def and await keywords
Uses context manager for session cleanup

output_examples.input: Create a Python decorator example for authentication
Generate a TypeScript interface example for beginners

best_practices: Use production-relevant examples that solve real problems, not toy applications
Teach one concept per example to avoid cognitive overload for learners
Align examples to specific learning objectives before generating code
anti_patterns: Mixing multiple concepts in single example (decorators + async + error handling)
Using toy examples like todo lists without production relevance
Presenting abstract explanation before concrete working code

faq.question: Does this skill support both Python and TypeScript?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill applies bilingual examples when concepts transfer between languages and monolingual when language-specific patterns apply.

faq.question: How does the skill handle complexity levels?
faq.answer: The skill targets proficiency levels from A1 (recognition) to B2+ (analysis). Each example specifies cognitive load and prerequisites.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with my existing spec files?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill reads specifications from your docs folder and generates examples aligned to approved specs.

faq.question: Does this skill execute the code it generates?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides validation steps (validate-syntax.py, sandbox-executor.py) but you run those separately.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Works with learning-objectives, concept-scaffolding, and technical-clarity skills for complete educational content.

faq.question: What makes this skill different from standard code generation?
faq.answer: Uses reasoning-activated pedagogy with spec-first validation, show-then-explain ordering, and anti-convergence monitoring.
